info.title: 3cixty Developer APIs

get.summary: Making augmented queries to the 3cixty KB
get.description:
The API makes a query to the `3cixty` KB.
Note that it depends on your queries, you might get information about events, as well as places of interest.
To execute a query without augmentation, please use another API.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A `3cixty access_token`. If the `3cixty access_token` is invalid (incorrect or expired), the `HTTP status code = 400` will be returned.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: A sparql query

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Requested result format (rdf or json)

parameters.name: coef
parameters.description: value is set to provide the weight to the social augmentation results. Default value is = "1"

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: chosen from the set = {`enteredrating`, `friends`}. This value is used to augment a given query based on user profile

parameters.name: debug
parameters.description: Default value is "off"

parameters.name: turnOffQA
parameters.description: value is set to turn off the augmentation. Default value is "true"

200.description: returns HTTP response with `Json/RDF`. Result set in the entity. Where the entity is result

400.description: either "The format is not supported or query is null" or you can also get "The key is invalid message".

post.description: The API is used to get elements in the `3cixty` KB (Events, POIs) with full information.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A 3cixty App Key.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: This header parameter is optional. If you don't specify it, all languages will be checked and we return data in one of the languages. You can use a format like `fr-FR`, `en-EN`, `en-US`, `fr`, `en`, `it`. You should use one of them.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: List of event IDs. Two event IDs are separated by a comma

parameters.name: place
parameters.description: List of PoI IDs. Two PoI IDs are separated by a comma.

200.description: returns HTTP response with `JSON/RDF` Result set in the entity. Where the entity is either a place or event

400.description: You can get "The key is invalid message"

get.summary: Get aggregated events
get.description:
This API is used to returns aggregated events.
Let us now describe parameters used
 - `group` here `<group>` can be one of six values from the following set: { `locality`, `category`, `country`, `publisher`, `placeName`, `artist` }.
 - `filter1` is a pair in `JSON` format following structure `{ "groupBy": "<groupby>", "value": "<value>" }` where `<groupby>` is one value from the above set and `<value>` is a string value you have to set to this <groupby>. This parameter is optional. 
   Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"locality","value" :"Milan"}`

    Note that the value of `<groupby>` in `filter1` should be different from a value you use in the URL for your HTTP request.
 - `filter2` is a pair in `JSON` format following structure `{ "groupBy": "<groupby>", "value": "<value>" }` where `<groupby>` is one value from the above set and `<value>` is a string value you have to set to this <groupby>. This parameter is optional. 
    Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"country","value":"france"}`

    Note that the value of `<groupby>` in `filter2` should be different from a value you use in the URL for your HTTP request and the value you used for `filter1`.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A 3cixty App Key.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: here `<group>` can be one of six values from the following set: { `locality`, `category`, `country`, `publisher`, `placeName`, `artist` }.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of result set for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: filter1
parameters.description:
is a pair in `JSON` format following structure `{ "groupBy": "<groupby>", "value": "<value>" }` where `<groupby>` is one value from the set and `<value>` is a string value you have to set to this <groupby>. This parameter is optional. Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"locality","value":"Milan"}`
Note that the value of `<groupby>` in `filter1` should be different from a value you use in the URL for your HTTP request.

parameters.name: filter2
parameters.description:
is a pair in `JSON` format following structure `{ "groupBy": "<groupby>", "value": "<value>" }` where `<groupby>` is one value from the above set and `<value>` is a string value you have to set to this <groupby>. This parameter is optional.  Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"country","value":"france"}`
Note that the value of `<groupby>` in `filter2` should be different from a value you use in the URL for your HTTP request and the value you used for `filter1`.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of choice. Currently supported cities are `milan`, `london`, `nice`.

200.description: Return is a `JSON` output defined by the value of `<groupby>` and the count that defines the number of entries under same unique `<groupby>`

400.description: You can get "The key is invalid message" or "The group is invalid. The group is one of locality, category, country, publishe, placeName, and artist" message

This parameter is optional. Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"locality","value":"Milan"}`

This parameter is optional.  Example for `filter1` is `{"groupBy":"country","value":"france"}`

get.summary: Get PoIs in detail
get.description:
The API is used to get POIs with details from the KnowledgeBase.
Let us now describe parameters used
 - `preference` can be one of the following values: `friend`,  `enteredrating`. This value is used to augment a given query based on user profile.
 - `category` is the businessType of the POI. for ex. `Restaurant`.
 - `minRating` Min. Rating of the POI. The Returned POIs should have rating more than minRating
 - `maxRating` Max Rating of the POI. The Returned POIs should have rating less than maxRating

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of result set for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: is the businessType of the POI. for ex. `Restaurant`.

parameters.name: minRating
parameters.description: Min. Rating of the POI. The Returned POIs should have rating more than minRating

parameters.name: maxRating
parameters.description: Max. Rating of the POI. The Returned POIs should have rating less than maxRating

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of choice. Currently supported cities are `milan`, `london`, `nice`.

parameters.name: preference
parameters.description: can be one of the following values: `friend`,  `enteredrating`. This value is used to augment a given query based on user profile.

200.description: Return is a `JSON` output defined by the value of `<groupby>` and the count that defines the number of entries under same unique `<groupby>`

400.description: You can get "The key is invalid message" message

get.summary: Get nearby PoIs of a PoI
get.description: The API is used to get nearby POIs from a given PoI ID.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A 3cixty App key.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: This header parameter is optional. If you don't specify it, all languages will be checked and we return data in one of the languages. You can use a format like `fr-FR`, `en-EN`, `en-US`, `fr`, `en`, `it`. You should use one of them.

parameters.name: poi
parameters.description: a PoI identity.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of result set for listing aggregated items. Note that if limit is large, it takes a lot of time to list nearby PoIs.

parameters.name: topCategories
parameters.description: is a list of top categories. Two top categories are separated by a comma. By default, if you don't give this parameter, it takes into account of all top categories.

parameters.name: categories
distance
parameters.description: The radius to list PoIs. The value is in kilometers.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of choice. Currently supported cities are `milan`, `london`, `nice`.

200.description: Return is a string in JSON format

400.description: You can get "The key is invalid message" message

get.summary: Get nearby PoIs to a given GPS location based on Wish List
get.description: The API is used to augment nearby POIs from a given GPS location. Nearby PoI augmentation is a feature to get nearby PoIs highlighting ones found from WishLists of friends list. The order of received nearby PoIs is first based on "highlighted" attribute, then distance is taken as the second key to decide the order if two PoIs have the same "highlighted attribute".

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: This header parameter is optional. If you don't specify it, all languages will be checked and we return data in one of the languages. You can use a format like `fr-FR`, `en-EN`, `en-US`, `fr`, `en`, `it`. You should use one of them.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: latitude.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: longitude.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of result set for listing aggregated items. Note that if limit is large, it takes a lot of time to list nearby PoIs.

parameters.name: topCategories
parameters.description: is a list of top categories. Two top categories are separated by a comma. By default, if you don't give this parameter, it takes into account of all top categories.

parameters.name: categories
distance
parameters.description: The radius to list PoIs. The value is in kilometers.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of choice. Currently supported cities are `milan`, `london`, `nice`.

200.description: Return is a string in JSON format

400.description: You can get "invalid access token" message

get.summary: Get nearby Events to a given GPS location based on Wish List
get.description: The API is used to augment nearby Events  from a given GPS location. Nearby Event augmentation is a feature to get nearby Events highlighting ones found from WishLists of friends list. The order of received nearby Events is first based on "highlighted" attribute, then distance is taken as the second key to decide the order if two Events have the same "highlighted attribute".

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: This header parameter is optional. If you don't specify it, all languages will be checked and we return data in one of the languages. You can use a format like `fr-FR`, `en-EN`, `en-US`, `fr`, `en`, `it`. You should use one of them.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: latitude.

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: longitude.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset for listing aggregated items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Size of result set for listing aggregated items. Note that if limit is large, it takes a lot of time to list nearby Events.

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: is a list of categories. Two categories are separated by a comma, for example: `Music` or `Music,Music Concert`. This parameter is optional. If you don't provide it, it will take into account of all categories related to Events.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: The radius to list Events. The value is in kilometers.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of choice. Currently supported cities are `milan`, `london`, `nice`.

200.description: Return is a string in JSON format

400.description: You can get "The key is invalid message" message

post.summary: Perform action on the Wish List
post.description:
(Additions to what is described above), depending on the action chosen (`add_tray_element`, `update_tray_element`, `get_tray_elements`, `login_tray`, `empty_tray`, `get_tray_elements_in_details`) the following json elements should be submitted.
For `action` = `add_tray_element`, following lists properties are required (should be provided):
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `element_id`, `element_type`, `element_title`, `image_url`,  `token`, `source`

For `action` = `update_tray_element`, following lists properties are either required (should be provided) or optionals:
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `element_id`, `element_type`, `element_title`, `token`, `source`
  - **Optional properties**: `delete`, `attend`, `attend_datetime`, `rating`
  
For `action` = `get_tray_elements`, following lists properties are either required (should be provided) or optionals:
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `token`
  - **Optional properties**: `offset`, `limit`, `order_type`, `show_past_events`

For `action` = `login_tray`, following lists properties are required (should be provided):
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `junk_token`, `three_cixty_token`

For `action` = `empty_tray`, following lists properties are required (should be provided):
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `token`

For `action` = `get_tray_elements_in_details`, following lists properties are either required (should be provided) or optionals:
  - **Required properties**: `action`, `key`, `token`
  - **Optional properties**: `offset`, `limit`, `order_type`, `show_past_events`, `language`

Here, following is the description of the properties mentioned above
  - `key` has the value which is the `3cixty App Key` of the application.
  - `token` has the value which is either a `3cixty access_token` or a `junk token`. If a junk token is provided the item will not appear in any specific user *Wish List*. It is only when the user signs in to the `3cixty` Platform the item is associated to the user. 
  - `element_type` has the value which is either `POI` or `Event`.
  - `attend_datetime` has the value which is a string with template `dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm`, for example `08-09-2014 10:00`.
  - `order_type` has the value which is either `Asc` or `Desc` with the default value being `Desc`. The *Wish List* items are ordered based on the time they were entered in the *Wish List*.
  - `language` has the value which is either `en`, `it`, `en-EN`, `it-IT` with the default value being `en`.
  - `attend` is a boolean that signifies if the item was visited or not.
  - `show_past_events` is a boolean
  - `offset` is a number with a default value of 0
  - `limit` is a number with a default value of 100
  - `junk_token` is a junk token in a string format.
  - `three_cixty_token` has the value which is a `3cixty access_token`.
  - `rating` is a value from 0 to 5 given to the item.
  - `element_id` is the id of the item.
  - `image_url` url of the image of the item.
  - `element_title` title of the item.
  - `delete` whether to delete the item or not.
  
Sample `json` object
  ```json
  {
    "key":"<key>", 
    "token":"<token>", 
    "action": "update_tray_element", 
    "element_id": "http://data.linkedevents.org/event/c78b678b-c51a-458f-8137-7f35abda121d",
    "element_type": "Event", 
    "source": "ExlorationApp+1.0", 
    "delete": "true"
  }
  ```
  
For `action`: `add_tray_element`, `update_tray_element` and `empty_tray` the returns HTTP response is a `JSON` that is of the format `{"response": "OK"}`

For `action`: `get_tray_element`, `login_tray` the returns HTTP response is a `JSON` that is of the format 
```json
  [
    { 
      "element_id": "ID_00001",
      "element_type": "events",
      "element_title": "Title 00001", 
      "timestamp": 122454544574, 
      "token": "junk00001", 
      "source": "Exploration", 
      "attend": false, 
      "attend_datetime": "08-12-2014 10:00", 
      "rating": -1, 
      "image_url": 
      "dumb link1" 
    }
  ]
  ```

For `action`: `get_tray_elements_in_details` the returns HTTP response is a `JSON` that is of the format 
```json
 [
  { 
    "type": "Event",
    "address": "<address>",
    "image_url": "<imageURL>",
    "locality": "<locality>",
    "name": "<name>",
    "description": "<description>",
  	"lon": "<longitude>",
  	"time_end": "<timeEventEnds>",
  	"source": "<sourceURL>",
  	"id": "<ID>",
  	"category": "<category>",
  	"time_beginning": "<StartingTimeOfEvent>",
  	"lat": "<latitude>",
  	"translation": true,
    "url": "<EventURL>",
    "creationTimestamp": 0,
    "rating": -1,
    "attend_datetime": "<attendDatetime>"
   },
   {  
    "type": "POI",
    "aggregate_rating": 0,
    "reviews": [  "<review1>" ],
    "reviewTranslations": [true],
    "image_url": "<imageURL>",
    "name": "<name>",
    "description": "<description>",
    "telephone": "<telephoneNumber>",
    "lon": "<longitude>",
    "source": "<sourceURL>",
  	"id": "<ID>",
    "review_counts": 1,
    "lat": "<latitude>",
  	"translation": true,
    "url": "<POIURL>",
    "creationTimestamp": 0,
    "rating": -1,
    "attend_datetime": "<attendDatetime>"
     }
  ]
  ```

parameters.name: wishlistPayload
parameters.description: Payload to be defined based on the above description.

action.description: valid list of actions is `add_tray_element`, `update_tray_element`,`get_tray_elements`, `login_tray`, `empty_tray`, `get_tray_elements_in_details`. You should chose one of the following. This is a required field.

key.description: `3cixty App key`. This is a required field.

element_type.description: `element_type` has the value which is either `POI` or `Event`.

image_url.description: url of the image of the item

token.description: has the value which is either a `3cixty access_token` or a `junk token`. If a junk token is provided the item will not appear in any specific user *Wish List*. It is only when the user signs in to the `3cixty` Platform the item is associated to the user.

source.description: source from where the element was gathered

delete.description: whether the item was delete the item or not

attend.description: whether item was attended/visited or not

attend_datetime.description: has the value which is a string with template `dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm`, for example `08-09-2014 10:00`

rating.description: `rating` from 0 to 5 given to the item

order_type.description: has the value which is either `Asc` or `Desc` with the default value being `Desc`. The *Wish List* items are ordered based on the time they were entered in the *Wish List*.

junk_token.description: is a junk token in a string format.

three_cixty_token.description: has the value which is a `3cixty access_token`.

language.description: has the value which is either `en`, `it`, `en-EN`, `it-IT` with the default value being `en`.

200.description:
depending on the`action` returns HTTP response with a `JSON` that is either `{"response": "OK"}` or `[{ "element_id": "ID_00001", "element_type": "events", "element_title": "Title 00001", "timestamp": 122454544574, "token": "junk00001", "source": "Exploration", "attend": false, "attend_datetime": "08-12-2014 10:00", "rating": -1, "image_url": 
  "dumb link1" }]` or `[ { "type": "Event", "address": "<address>", "image_url": "<imageURL>", "locality": "<locality>", "name": "<name>", "description": "<description>", "lon": "<longitude>", "time_end": "<timeEventEnds>", "source": "<sourceURL>", "id": "<ID>", "category": "<category>", "time_beginning": "<StartingTimeOfEvent>", "lat": "<latitude>", "translation": true, "url": "<EventURL>", "creationTimestamp": 0, "rating": -1, "attend_datetime": "<attendDatetime>" }, { "type": "POI", "aggregate_rating": 0, "reviews": [  "<review1>" ], "reviewTranslations": [true],  "image_url": "<imageURL>", "name": "<name>", "description": "<description>", "telephone": "<telephoneNumber>", "lon": "<longitude>", "source": "<sourceURL>", "id": "<ID>",  "review_counts": 1, "lat": "<latitude>", "translation": true,  "url": "<POIURL>", "creationTimestamp": 0, "rating": -1, "attend_datetime": "<attendDatetime>" } ]`

schema.description: depending on the `action`, `JSON` object is returned.

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate HTTP status code with a message is returned. Some example of returned messages are:

 - Invalid parameters

 - Invalid parameters or duplicated tray items

 - Failed to understand your tray request

 - The key is invalid

post.description:
This API helps developers to send user feedback to `3cixty` Platform. This API can be used by mobile clients to report user feedback from within the apps. The feedbacks are stored on the platform for later retrieval by the person in charge or analysing the issues.
  
This API requires a `JSON` input of the following format
```json
  {
    "clientTimeStamp": "<clientTimeStamp>",
    "clientVersion": "<clientVersion>",
    "reason": "<reason>",
    "userToken": "<userToken>",
    "key": "<Appkey>",
    "otherReasonText": "<otherReasonText>",
    "lastPage": "<lastPage>", 
    "lastElement": "<lastElement>", 
    "lastPosition": "<lastPosition>"
  }
  ```
Here:

  - `clientTimeStamp`: This is a **required** parameter. It is `xsd:dateTime`, with timeZone, for example: "2002-10-10T12:00:00-05:00".
  - `clientVersion`: This is a **required** parameter. It is a string, for example "Android-1.4". 
  - `reason`: This is a **required** parameter. It is a string that can be: 
      - `WRONG_DATA`: in case the user presses the GUI button to report that the event/POI data he's looking at on the screen looks wrong. For example: item title is empty/null.
      - `CRASH`: user wants to report a crash happened on the mobile app.
      - `LOGIN`: user has problems to login with his account.
      - `OTHER`: used to report any other feedback, detailed using a free-text box on the GUI. If `OTHER` is selected, then `otherReasonText` should also be provided and `otherReasonText` cannot be null.
  - `otherReasonText`: it is a string that specifies a reason not listed by WRONG_DATA, CRASH or LOGIN. Sample `<otherReasonText>` is "the map view does not work!!!".
  - `userToken`: it is the `3cixty access_token`. Either `userToken` or `key` should be specified.
  - `key`: it is the `3cixty App Key`. Either `userToken` or `key` should be specified.
  - `lastPage`: is class of the last app view used. It is a string. for example "`com.3cixty.client.NavigationPage`".
  - `lastElement`: is the ID of the Event or the POI the user was looking at. It is a string.
  - `lastPosition`: is the position (lat, lon in `WGS84`, double) and accuracy (in meters, double) of the user's last position. For example [45.477760, 9.234779,3000].

  
  Below is the sample `Json` object
  
  ```JSON
    {
      "clientTimeStamp": "2002-10-10T12:00:00-05:00",
      "clientVersion": "Android-1.4", 
      "reason": "WRONG_DATA", 
      "userToken": "1234xyz", 
      "lastPage": "com.3cixty.client.NavigationPage", 
      "lastElement": "xyz568568", 
      "lastPosition": [45.477760, 9.234779,3000] 
    }
  ```

parameters.name: feedbackPayload
parameters.description: Payload to be defined based on the above description.

clientTimeStamp.description: It is `xsd:dateTime`, with timeZone, for example: "2002-10-10T12:00:00-05:00"

clientVersion.description: It is a string, for example "Android-1.4".

reason.description:
It is a string that can be: 
 - `WRONG_DATA`: in case the user presses the GUI button to report that the event/POI data he's looking at on the screen looks wrong. For example: item title is empty/null.
 - `CRASH`: user wants to report a crash happened on the mobile app.
 - `LOGIN`: user has problems to login with his account.
 - `OTHER`: used to report any other feedback, detailed using a free-text box on the GUI. If `OTHER` is selected, then `otherReasonText` should also be provided and `otherReasonText` cannot be null.

userToken.description: it is the `3cixty access_token`. Either `userToken` or `key` should be specified.

key.description: it is the `3cixty App Key`. Either `userToken` or `key` should be specified.

otherReasonText.description: it is a string that specifies a reason not listed by WRONG_DATA, CRASH or LOGIN. Sample `<otherReasonText>` is "the map view does not work!!!".

lastPage.description: is class of the last app view used. It is a string. for example "`com.3cixty.client.NavigationPage`".

lastElement.description: is the ID of the Event or the POI the user was looking at. It is a string.

lastPosition.description: is the position (lat, lon in `WGS84`, double) & accuracy (in meters, double) of the user's last position. For example [45.477760, 9.234779,3000].

200.description: returns HTTP response with message "Successful".

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. Example of returned messages are:
- Empty request - Your userToken is invalid - Your key is invalid - Your request must contain either userToken or key - Client version is required - Reason is required - Your report request must be in JSON format - Client timestamp is required - Client timestamp is invalid. The pattern looks like: 2002-10-10T12:00:00-05:00"

get.summary: Get MoveSmarter user account credentials
get.description:
If there exists an account corresponding with a given `3cixty access_token`, the API will return the `MoveSmarter` account of the user; otherwise, the API tries to create a new account on MoveSmarter server. If this creation is successful, the API will return the new account; otherwise, the API return an empty `JSON` string `{}`

  The return of the HTTP request is in `JSON` format is based on the `3cixty access_token` input:
  For valid `3cixty access_token`: 
  - If there exists a `MoveSmarter` account, the return message follows the structure `{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>"}` with the `HTTP code status = 200`.
  - if there does not exists a `MoveSmarter` account, the API tries to create the account.
    - on a successful creation `{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>"}` is returned with `HTTP code status = 200`.
    - If an error occurs the return message is `{}`.
  
  For Invalid `3cixty access_token`: `HTTP status code = 400` is returned with message `The access token is invalid`.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in the following `JSON` format: `{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>"}`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. Some example of returned messages are:
- The access token is invalid

503.description: On the failure `service unavailable` message is returned

get.summary: Get MoveSmarter one time use token for user
get.description:
This API creates a `MoveSmarter` account if there doesn't exist before invoking it. If successful to get a token from `MoveSmarter` server, this API will return `MoveSmarter` token and expiration in a `JSON` format. If failed, this API will respond with `HTTP status code = 400` and relevant error message.

 The return of your HTTP request in `JSON` format is based on your `3cixty access_token` input:
   
 For valid access_token:
 
 - If the API is able to get a `MoveSmarter` token, it will send back a `JSON` string like: 
         
     ```json
     {
       "timeLeft": <timeleft>
       "token": "<token>"
     }
     ```
 
   Here:
   - `timeLeft` is the remaining time where the corresponding `MoveSmarter` token is still valid. This value is in second.
     Note that, the maximum timeLeft value is `7200`.
     
   - Otherwise, the API returns `HTTP status code = 400`.
   
 For Invalid `3cixty access_token`: HTTP code status is 400 with message "The access token is invalid".

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in a JSON format like; `{ "timeLeft": <timeleft>, "token": "<token>"}`

token.description: MoveSmarter server one time use token

timeleft.description: is the remaining time where the corresponding token is still valid. This value is in second.

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. Some example of returned messages are:
- The access token is invalid

post.summary: Register an App on GoFlow server
post.description:
**This API should not be used by App developers as this API is already referenced when you get a `3cixty App key`.**


The return of the HTTP request is in JSON format.
- If the `HTTP status code = 400`, it means that the api failed to register your App.
- If the `HTTP status code = 200`, it means that the api was successful to register your App.

parameters.name: google_access_token
parameters.description: A Google access_token.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in the following `JSON` format `{"response": true}`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. The return is in the following `JSON` format `{"response": false, "reason": "<message>"}`. Some example of returned messages are:
- Google access_token is invalid or expired
- Cannot register your App on GoFlow server or your AppKey is invalid

get.summary: Create or retrieve a GoFlow developer account credentials
get.description:
This API is used to create or retrieve a `GoFlow` account for developers to communicate with `GoFlow` server.
The return of HTTP request is in the JSON format.



 - If the `HTTP status code = 400`, it means the provided `3cixty
access_token` is invalid

 - If the `HTTP status code = 200`, it means either:

   - If your response text is an empty `JSON` object (equal to `{}`), it
means the API failed to create or retrieve `GoFlow` account associated with the provided `3cixty access_token`.

   - Otherwise the response `JSON` is of the following format:
`{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>", "appid": "<appid>"}` where the values `<username>` and `<password>` are `GoFlow` account information associated with the provided `3cixty access_token` and `<appid>` is the associated app of the developer.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in the following JSON format `{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>", "appid": "<appid>" }`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message from the following is returned. The return is in following `JSON` format `{"response": false, "reason": "<message>"}`. Some example of returned messages are:

 - The access token is invalid

 - Cannot create user at GoFlow

get.summary: Create or retrieve a GoFlow user account credentials
get.description:
This api is used to create or retrieve a `GoFlow` user account based on a `3cixty access_token.
The return of HTTP request is in the JSON format.



 - If the `HTTP status code = 400`, it means the provided `3cixty
access_token` is invalid

 - If the `HTTP status code = 200`, it means either:

   - If your response text is an empty `JSON` object (equal to `{}`), it
means the API failed to create or retrieve `GoFlow` account associated with the provided `3cixty access_token`.

   - Otherwise the response `JSON` is of the following format:
`{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>", "appid": "<appid>"}` where the values `<username>` and `<password>` are `GoFlow` account information associated with the provided `3cixty access_token` and `<appid>` is the associated app used by the user.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in the following JSON format `{"username": "<username>", "password": "<password>", "appid": "<appid>" }`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message from the following is returned. The return is in following `JSON` format `{"response": false, "reason": "<message>"}`. Some example of returned messages are:

 - The access token is invalid

 - Cannot create user at GoFlow

get.summary: Get User Profile Information
get.description:
The API is used to extract user personal information the is stored in the 3cixty Knowledgebase.
 
The return of request is in JSON format.
 - If the `HTTP status code = 200`, the response `JSON` is like `{"uid":"<uid>","firstName":"<firstName>","lastName":"<lastName>","latitude":<latitude>,"profileImage":"<ProfileimageURL>","longitude":<longitude>}`.
 - If the `HTTP status code = 400`, this could be due to permission denied by user or invalid `3cixty access_token`, etc. The return thus is either one of the following:
    - You are not allowed to access the user profile.
    - There is no information of your profile in the KB.
    - The access token is invalid.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in a JSON format like `{"uid":"<uid>","firstName":"<firstName>","lastName":"<lastName>","latitude":<latitude>,"profileImage":"<ProfileimageURL>","longitude":<longitude>}`.

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message from the following is returned. Some example of returned messages are:

 - You are not allowed to access the user profile

 - There is no information of your profile in the KB

 - The access token is invalid

get.summary: Get the UserID from the 3cixty access_token
get.description:
The API is used to get 3cixty UID of the user from the `3cixty access_token`. 
The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format.
- If the `HTTP status code = 200` the response text is: `{"uid":"<uid>"}`.
- If the `HTTP status code = 400`, the return is following:
  - The access token is invalid

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in a JSON format `{"uid":"<uid>"}`

400.description:
If the HTTP status code response is 400, the return is following:
 - The access token is invalid

get.summary: Get/generate 3cixty App key
get.description:
This API is used to get `3cixty App key` by the developers. 
Let us now describe the parameters required:
 - `google_access_token`: Your `Google access_token`. You might get a `Google access_token` by calling the `3cixty` Google token endpoint.
 - `appid`: Your application identity. This value must be unique within the `3cixty` Platform. Typically, an appid could be a name like `com.sample.foo` or just anything (without any fullstops).
 - `appname`: Your application name, for example `3cixty Test App`.
 - `category`: Your application category. You might use one of the following values: `Exploration`, `MobileGuide`, and `AppChallenge`. For App Challenge developers, you should use the AppChallenge category for yours.
 - `description`: Your application description to explain about what your application does. 
 - `redirect_uri`: A redirect uri for web applications. 
 - `thumbNailUrl`: A logo link for web applications. This logo is used to show permission question to your users when your web application asks your users to grant permission to access to his private data. This value is not required for Android applications, but mandatory for Web applications.

The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format. If you are successful to get an app key, the 3cixty Platform will respond a message with the content as `{"key": "<ThreeCixtyAppKey>"}`; otherwise, you will receive 400 for HTTP status code and a text also the following `JSON` format `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}` explaining you about errors.

Error reasons returned are:
 - AppId already existed or scopeName doesn't exist
 - Google access token is invalid or expired
 - appId only contains characters in the following patterns ^[a-z_A-Z0-9:\\-]*
 - Cannot register App on GoFlow server
 - appId already existed or scopeName doesn't exist

parameters.name: google_access_token
parameters.description: A Google access_token.

parameters.name: appid
parameters.description: Your application identity. This value must be unique within the `3cixty` Platform. Typically, an appid could be a name like `com.sample.foo` or just anything (without any fullstops).

parameters.name: appname
parameters.description: Your application name, for example `3cixty Test App`.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Your application category. You might use one of the following values: `Exploration`, `MobileGuide`, and `AppChallenge`. For App Challenge developers, you should use the AppChallenge category for yours.

parameters.name: scopeName
parameters.description: List of 3cixty scopes requested by the App. if not specified all scopes are used.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Your application description to explain about what your application does. default value is ""

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: A redirect uri for web applications.

parameters.name: thumbNailUrl
parameters.description: A logo link for web applications. This logo is used to show permission question to your users when your web application asks your users to grant permission to access to his private data. This value is not required for Android applications, but mandatory for Web applications.

200.description: returns HTTP response in the following `JSON` format `{"key": "<ThreeCixtyAppKey>"}`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. The return is in `JSON` format, for example `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<message>"}`. Some example of returned messages are:
 - AppId already existed or scopeName doesn't exist
 - Google access token is invalid or expired
 - appId only contains characters in the following patterns ^[a-z_A-Z0-9:\\-]*
 - Cannot register App on GoFlow server
 - appId already existed or scopeName doesn't exist

post.description:
This API is to update information on the `3cixty` Platform related to the App. 

Let us now describe the parameters required
 - `google_access_token`: Your `Google acces_token`. You might get a `Google access_token` by calling the `3cixty` Google token endpoint.
 - `appid`: Your application identity. This value must be unique within the `3cixty` Platform. Typically, an appid could be a name like `com.sample.foo` or just anything (without any fullstops).
 - `appname`: Your application name, for example `3cixty Test App`.
 - `category`: Your application category. You might use one of the following values: `Exploration`, `MobileGuide`, and `AppChallenge`. For App Challenge developers, you should use the AppChallenge category for yours.
 - `description`: Your application description to explain about what your application does. 
 - `redirect_uri`: A redirect uri for web applications. 
 - `thumbNailUrl`: A logo link for web applications. This logo is used to show permission question to your users when your web application asks your users to grant permission to access to his private data. This value is not required for Android applications, but mandatory for Web applications.

The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format. If you are successful to update an app key, the 3cixty Platform will respond a message with the content as `{"response": "Successful"}`; otherwise, you will receive 400 for HTTP status code and a text also the following `JSON` format `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}` explaining you about errors.

Error reasons returned are:
 - Google access token is invalid or expired
 - appId only contains characters in the following patterns ^[a-z_A-Z0-9:\\-]*

get.summary: Get 3cixty access_token from Google access_token
get.description:
This API is used to get `3cixty access_token` from `Google access_token`. **This API is only used by trusted `3cixty` apps**.
Let us now describe the parameters required
 - `google_access_token`: Your `Google access_token`. You might get a `Google access_token` by calling the 3cixty Google token endpoint.

The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format. If the validation is successful, the 3cixty Platform will respond a message like `{"response": "<ThreeCixtyAccessToken>"}` to you; otherwise, you will get an error message like `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}`.
 
 Error reasons returned are:
  - App key is invalid
  - App key is not allowed to get access token
  - Google access token is invalid or expired
  - scope is invalid
  - Internal errors

parameters.description: list of 3cixty scopes in a comma separated syntax.

Error reasons returned are:

 - App key is invalid

 - App key is not allowed to get access token

 - Google access token is invalid or expired

 - scope is invalid

 - Internal errors

get.summary: Refresh a 3cixty access_token
get.description:
This API is to refresh a `3cixty access_token` in the case where the current `3cixty access_token` is no longer valid because each `3cixty access_token` only lasts for a day. When you refresh a `3cixty access_token`, the `3cixty` Platform doesn't need to have interaction with users, so you can call this API through your code in Java or any other languages.

The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format. If the validation is successful, the `3cixty` Platform will respond a message like `{"access_token": "<ThreeCixtyAccessToken>", "refresh_token": "<ThreeCixtyRefreshToken>", "expires_in": <number>, "scope": "<Scopes>"}` to you; otherwise, you will get an error message of the format `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}`.
 
 Error reasons returned are:
  - refresh token is invalid

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty refresh_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in a JSON format  like `{"access_token": "<ThreeCixtyAccessToken>", "refresh_token": "<ThreeCixtyRefreshToken>", "expires_in": <number>, "scope": "<Scopes>"}``

expires_in.description: time in secs left in the expiry of the access token

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. You will get an error message of the format `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}`.
Error reasons returned are:

 - refresh token is invalid

get.summary: Revoke a 3cixty access_token
get.description:
This API is used to revoke a `3cixty access_token`.

The return of your HTTP request is in `JSON` format. If the validation is successful, the `3cixty` Platform will respond a message like `{"response": "Successful"}` to you; otherwise, you will get an error message like `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}`.
 
 Error reasons returned are:
  - an invalid access token or internal error

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: A 3cixty access_token.

200.description: returns HTTP response in a JSON of the format `{"response": "Successful"}`

400.description:
On the failure an appropriate message is returned. You will get an error message like `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<reason>"}`.
Error reasons returned are:

 - an invalid access token or internal error

Otherwise, On the failure an appropriate message is returned. The return is in `JSON` format, for example `{"response": "failed", "reason": "<message>"}`. Some example of returned messages are: - App key is empty - App key is invalid - Email is empty - Email is invalid - Your email and password don't match.
